department.ch: 產業經濟研究所碩士班

goal.ch: Students are expected to gain a concrete understanding of the way industrial organizations operate and apply economic models to analyze competition, market power, regulation, and social welfare.
goal.en: Students are expected to gain a concrete understanding of the way industrial organizations operate and apply economic models to analyze competition, market power, regulation, and social welfare.

outline.ch: A basic understanding of calculus and probability theory is expected.
outline.en: A basic understanding of calculus and probability theory is expected.

textbook.ch: Our lectures closely follow Paul Belleflamme and Martin Peitz (2015), Industrial Organization – Markets and Strategies, 2nd Edition, Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press (denoted “BP“). Please obtain a copyright version of this textbook, and supplementary learning materials, such as journal articles, will be disseminated in class. You may also consult the following textbook to better your understanding of industrial economics. On the more theoretical side, Jean Tirole (1988)‘s The Theory of Industrial Organization, 1st Edition, published by the MIT Press would be a very good reference for model-builders. On the more intuitive side, Lynne Pepall, Dan Richards, George Norman (2014)‘s Industrial Organization: Contemporary Theory and Empirical Applications, 5th Edition, published by John Wiley ＆ Sons, Inc. would help you put the economic models in context. Other good references which I also recommend are Dennis W. Carlton and Jeffrey M. Perloff (2005)‘s Modern Industrial Organization, Global Edition, 4th Edition, published by Pearson PLC, for you to derive insights from simplified models that I present in class. You may also read Luis M. B. Cabral (2000)‘s Introduction to Industrial Organization, 2nd Edition, published by The MIT Press for you to frame your ideas from different perspectives.
textbook.en: Our lectures closely follow Paul Belleflamme and Martin Peitz (2015), Industrial Organization – Markets and Strategies, 2nd Edition, Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press (denoted “BP“). Please obtain a copyright version of this textbook, and supplementary learning materials, such as journal articles, will be disseminated in class. You may also consult the following textbook to better your understanding of industrial economics. On the more theoretical side, Jean Tirole (1988)‘s The Theory of Industrial Organization, 1st Edition, published by the MIT Press would be a very good reference for model-builders. On the more intuitive side, Lynne Pepall, Dan Richards, George Norman (2014)‘s Industrial Organization: Contemporary Theory and Empirical Applications, 5th Edition, published by John Wiley ＆ Sons, Inc. would help you put the economic models in context. Other good references which I also recommend are Dennis W. Carlton and Jeffrey M. Perloff (2005)‘s Modern Industrial Organization, Global Edition, 4th Edition, published by Pearson PLC, for you to derive insights from simplified models that I present in class. You may also read Luis M. B. Cabral (2000)‘s Introduction to Industrial Organization, 2nd Edition, published by The MIT Press for you to frame your ideas from different perspectives.

gradMethod.ch: 30％ Problem Sets, 20％ Mid-term Exam, 20％ Final Exam, 30％ Term Project
gradMethod.en: 30％ Problem Sets, 20％ Mid-term Exam, 20％ Final Exam, 30％ Term Project

ch.competencies: 獨立思考和解決問題能力

ch: 系所:限產業經濟研究所碩士班、產業經濟研究所博士班。年級:限一年級。
學制:限碩士班、博士班。學院:限管理學院。
學制:限學士班。年級:限四年級。
en: Department:Master of Industrial Economics、PhD in Industrial Economics only.Year:First Year only.
Type:Master's Program、Doctoral Program only.Faculty:College of Management only.
